N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 510.6 - Cost Effectiveness Presumption

State Regulations
(a) An

Energy Code update shall be presumed to be cost effective if the Net Present

Value of Life-cycle Cost Impacts as determined in section
510.3
of this Part plus the Net

Present Value of Societal Effects as determined in section
510.4
of this Part is greater than
or equal to zero. (b) Existing
buildings. A proposed Energy Code update will be presumed to be cost effective
in existing buildings subject to the proposed Energy Code update if they are
cost effective in new buildings as determined in subdivision (a) of this
section. Notes
